scopecontent.p: The collection consists of genealogical and research materials compiled by Reverend Carl T. Smith. Historical and genealogical information pertains to areas and people of Pennsylvania and Ohio, including Dayton, Montgomery County, Jefferson Township (all Ohio), Philadelphia, and Bucks County. Information is extracted from land records, cemetery records, tax records, church records, register of wills, and newspapers. The collection also includes a typescript of Smith's thesis, titled The History of German Lutheranism in Pennsylvania Before Muhlenberg, with Especial Emphasis on John Caspar Stoever, Jr., published in 1943 (submitted for Bachelor of Divinity at Union Theological Seminary), and research materials on Presbyterian and Reformed churches, including lists of members, notes on church histories and deeds belonging to various churches (mostly city and county of Philadelphia and other areas of Pennsylvania). There are issues of The County Court Note-Book: A Little Bulletin of History and Genealogy, 1923-1931 (published by Milnor Ljungstedt in Bethesda, Maryland) and a scrapbook of genealogical clippings from an Ohio newspaper and a similar notebook entitled "Our Forefathers or Miami Valley Genealogies" by Lindsay M. Brien.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
